CatDescriptText: Julius Timko, meat plant worker, Mount Oliver and Dan Marin, art student, Phillipsburg, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 14, 1961, pg. B1 with question: "At what age should young folks be allowed to have unchaperoned parties?" Julius Timko's answer reads: "About 16, because they are more or less sensible, and they are coming to the point of view of an adult."  Dan Marin's answer reads: "About 16.  It appears they are old enough at that age."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Julius Timko wearing baseball cap and jacket with leather sections and herringbone sleeves, standing in front of store window with display; Portrait of Dan Marin wearing light colored jacket with dark ribbed collar, standing in front of building
